This is because it is the nature of defilement.
Those born from it and so forth should be explained according to the previous example.
There are two more sets of explanations of crooked, defiled, and turbid actions.
They are different from this treatise.
Fearing prolixity, I will not relate them.

On the nineteenth day of the eighth month of the third year of the Bao Yan era, I finished proofreading at the east corridor of the southeast courtyard. The old master of decline and old age, Jue Shu, proofread one copy of the old text from the Huang Yuan.
